Dear Ms. Stevens:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 5/31/24. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action
plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (517) 243-9743.
Sincerely,
Heather Reilly, Licensing Consultant

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except for
the following:
CPA Rule 400.12324 Reevaluation
(4) An agency shall document placement specifications
consistent with the information contained in the
reevaluation. The placement specifications must include
all the following:
(a) The age, number, SOGIE, race, ethnic background,
and characteristics of children preferred by the
applicants.
Three of six foster home files held renewal evaluations that did not identify
r ecommendations regarding SOGIE.
CPA Rule 400.12326 Borrowed home
(1) Before placing a child in a foster home certified by
another agency the borrowing agency shall have a
record containing all the following:
(f) Documentation that the foster parent has received
orientation to the policies of the borrowing agency.
One of three borrowed home files did not have documentation that agency
orientation to policies and procedures was reviewed.

CPA Rule 400.12326 Borrowed home
(1) Before placing a child in a foster home certified by
another agency, the borrowing agency shall have a
record containing all the following:
(g) A copy of the foster parent/agency agreement
signed by the foster parent and the borrowing agency
One of three borrowed home files did not have documentation the foster parent
agency agreement was reviewed or signed.
CPA Rule 400.12327 Special evaluation
(5) Within 15 days of the conclusion of the evaluation,
an agency shall complete a written report that includes
all the following information:
(d) Findings of fact, based upon the evaluation.
One of two special evaluations did not document interviews with members of the
household that were present during the alleged incident. The report also did not
document any investigation into a secondary allegation.
FOM 722-06B Family Team Meeting
FTMs must occur within the required time frames as
outlined in the following tables:
Updated Case Plan (USP)- within 30 calendar days
before the case plan due date.
Three of three foster care files and one of one independent living files, each held
one family team meeting that was not completed within 30 days prior to a USP.

IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Special Evaluations: When conducting a special evaluation in coordination
with DHHS, the agency must work cooperatively with DHHS. However, the
agency must also complete a thorough investigation that can stand alone and
address all allegations thoroughly when read independently from the DHHS
report. This means completion of interviews with all involved persons or
witnesses, and documentation of investigation and outcome for each

allegation. DCWL consultants are available for ongoing consultation as
needed.
• Enrolled applicants: The agency was advised to keep case contacts updated
with enrolled applicants. Updated contacts help demonstrate ongoing
progress toward certification.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• There was no consultation requested or required.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted two acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during
this licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows:
• The agency interim inspection was completed on 8/23/23 with a CAP
approved on 9/6/23. The agency was cited for six violations. Of those
six violations there was improvement in most areas. There was one
repeat violation regarding Family Team Meetings(FTM). Additional
corrective action planning is needed regarding timely FTMs to ensure
continued reduction of violations.
• Special Investigation 2024C0001093SI was completed 2/22/24. The
investigation determined a violation of PA 116 722.120, as a caseworker
inaccurately documented that a home visit was completed with a child,
when the visit did not occur. A CAP was approved on 2/26/24.
Compliance verification is ongoing.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment was reviewed and discussed on-site. The
agency reported continued difficulty in staffing, as there have been few qualified
applicants that have applied for open positions. The staffing shortage has also
impacted the agency's ability to accept cases from referral sources. Which has
resulted in much lower case counts over the past several months.

In addition to hiring, the agency continues to focus on staff retention and have
ongoing conversations with current staff to address their needs and promote a
supportive workplace.
The agency reported they have successfully implemented the 2023 CAP. Staff
meet quarterly to review CAP items and discuss progress. The Chief Administrator
indicated any repeat violations are likely due to systemic issues, as the agency felt
confident with CAP compliance.
The agency reported one disrupted placement during the review period, due to
findings from a DHHS investigation.
Financial Overview
The 2023 financial audit has not been completed yet. The 2024 budget was
reviewed, and no financial concerns were found.
Staff Interviews
Two staff were interviewed on-site. Both staff reported being with the agency for
over a year. One staff as a foster care case manager and the other as a licensing
worker. Both staff stated they felt very supported in their work. They both reported
their supervisor was knowledgeable, supportive, available, and able to help them
problem solve. Neither staff had any suggestions nor identified areas for
improvement.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency continues to be located in the same building as the 2023 review. The
office is clean and easily accessible to clients. There is adequate space for staff
and clients to interact. There is sufficient locked storage for confidential
information.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
Safety Alert #1: On 4/24/24 the home was found to lack a carbon monoxide
detector.
Resolution: On 4/25/24 the agency purchased a carbon monoxide detector and
installed it in the home. A photo was provided to DCWL as verification.
Safety Alert #2: After multiple attempted contacts, the relative caregiver was non-
compliant in scheduling a visit with the DCLW analyst. The agency was informed on
4/10/24.
Resolution: On 4/11/24 the agency made phone contact with the relative
caregiver. The relative reported she would contact the DCWL analyst. However,
this did not occur. On 4/17/24 the agency completed a home visit to verify well-
being of the child. No concerns were noted. The relative stated she was too busy to
meet with the analyst.

VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
